s.text: JW and ME made equal contributions to this work.
JW and ME made equal contributions to this work.
All authors read and approved the final manuscript.
The overall pattern of gene expression provides clues to the diverse functions of Wnt proteins in cancer, cell fate decisions and other developmental events.

Moreover, Frizzled receptors, Versican and other proteoglycans which contribute to Wnt protein activity are also controlled by Wnt signaling, as previously described in Drosophila [ 28 29 ] . At the level of transcriptional regulation, we found up-regulation of CBP/P300, which partners with ?-catenin [ 30 31 ] but also TLE/Groucho, which is an inhibitor of TCF function [ 32 ] . These responses suggest a rich system of homeostasis and feedback control mechanisms, but they complicate the interpretation of experimental studies of Wnt signal transduction in which the time course of induction cannot be controlled easily.

In initial experiments, we found that Wnt-3A protein elevates the levels of ?-catenin 5-10 fold (Figure 4); and that a transiently transfected TCF reporter construct is activated 3-4 fold (not shown).
Of the factors that contribute to specifying cell fate during development, Wnt proteins are among the most attractive candidates to use in such in vitro experiments.

At the level of transcriptional regulation, we found up-regulation of CBP/P300, which partners with ?-catenin [ 30 31 ] but also TLE/Groucho, which is an inhibitor of TCF function [ 32 ] . These responses suggest a rich system of homeostasis and feedback control mechanisms, but they complicate the interpretation of experimental studies of Wnt signal transduction in which the time course of induction cannot be controlled easily.
MSX1 expression was markedly elevated by the combination of BMP-4 and Wnt-3A.
[ 9 ] . By adding antibody to alkaline phosphatase, all of the detectable Wnt-3A protein could be removed from the medium.

In the absence of a Wnt signal, GSK3 phosphorylates ?-catenin, which then becomes targeted for degradation [ 6 ] . The binding of Wnt to its receptors initiates a cascade of events that inhibit GSK3 and ultimately prevent degradation of ?-catenin.
